channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Erik Menendez Has Been Denied Parole. Here’s What to Know.
item.description: A California parole panel said Mr. Menendez should not be released from prison, 36 years after he and his brother, Lyle, killed their parents. Lyle’s ...

item.title: Trump’s Gerrymandering Push Is a Form of Cheating
item.description: Gerrymandering is a form of cheating. And it is preventable.

item.title: Trump’s 19-year war on wind power is ‘weaponizing bureaucracy to undermine American energy production,’ critics say
item.description: Trump is tying wind and solar projects up in ever-increasing bureaucratic layers and reviews while expediting fossil fuels.

item.title: Trump Budget Office Is Withholding H.I.V. Funds That Congress Appropriated
item.description: Lawmakers allocated $6 billion this fiscal year for PEPFAR, the H.I.V. prevention and treatment program, but the administration has indicated it will ...

item.title: Former Siemens and Alcoa CEO Klaus Kleinfeld dismisses the idea of work-life separation: ‘You are one person’
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: MAHA Is a Bad Answer to a Good Question
item.description: Rachael Bedard and David Wallace-Wells on Covid disillusionment and the rise of the MAHA movement.

item.title: Thaksin Shinawatra, Former Thai Premier, Cleared of Insulting Monarchy
item.description: But the reprieve for Thaksin Shinawatra, who remains a political force, did not mean that the legal troubles for him and his family were over.

item.title: Nathaniel B. Palmer, a U.S. Icebreaker, May Have Sailed Its Last Expedition
item.description: The decommissioning would leave the United States with no icebreaker to study the southern seas and cede scientific leadership to rival countries like...

item.title: Congo Has Astronomical Rates of Sexual Violence. Now Victims Have Lost Access to Care.
item.description: The conflict that has put rebels in control of much of the east of the country has left victims with no legal recourse and dismantled many of the clin...

item.title: The Hobbyist Restorer Who Rocked the Art World With an A.I. Innovation
item.description: Alex Kachkine spends his days working on microchip research — a skill set surprisingly similar to that needed for restoration.

item.title: Map: 7.5-Magnitude Earthquake Strikes the South Atlantic Ocean
item.description: View the location of the quake’s epicenter and shake area.

item.title: Israel Is Expanding Its Gaza City Operation, but Where Does It Stand?
item.description: The Israeli government is widening its operation in Gaza despite its generals’ advice and as it deliberates on a new cease-fire proposal.

item.title: The white-collar job market is frozen—now bartenders and baristas are seeing bigger wage growth than desk workers
item.description: Gen Zers who are lucky enough to get an office job: Don’t expect a raise.

item.title: Bitcoin dips ahead of Fed chair’s remarks at Jackson Hole
item.description: The world’s largest cryptocurrency is down almost 5% after notching an all-time high one week ago.

item.title: China’s DeepSeek quietly releases an open-source rival to GPT-5—optimized for Chinese chips and priced to undercut OpenAI
item.description: DeepSeek is forcing the U.S.–China AI rivalry into sharper focus and may put OpenAI on the back foot following its disappointing GPT-5 launch.
